job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Louisville, KY

pros: Love taking care of kids, this is the place to be

pros: Learning experience, quick to get the more challenging assignments, not stuck taking feeder growers all the time. Learned a lot fast/ thrown into the environment.
cons: Heavy assignments, short staff, someone always reviewing your work/ scrutiny. Don’t forget to label a line or date a mepilex or you will get in trouble. I was wrote up for someone claiming I didn’t change a mepilex (I’m pretty sure I did), but I couldn’t prove it. Was forced to sign papers by an aggressive ANM who has since been promoted. Don’t count on getting any of the PTO you request, will have to cal in for the days you need off and take points you need for sick days. I worked as a CNA at Norton’s for years before becoming a RN and the environment was always the same.

pros: Norton Healthcare not only cares about their patients needs, but they also care about their employees as well. In all the years that I have worked in healthcare this is the best company that I have ever worked for. I can honestly say that this is a place that I hope to be blessed to work at for many years and retire from. I am great full everyday that I get to walk through those doors and work for an amazing hospital.
cons: The only con is that there is some favoritism on each unit, but that will happen no matter where you work or what company you work for.

job_title: Respiratory Care Practitioner in Louisville, KY
pros:
Great Benefits
Standard Pay
Culture Education
Opportunities to branch into other areas (ECMO ect)
cons:
Above all: Poor training. 2-3 days on the main floor and then you're off orientation. Who does that, seriously?

Patient work load is impossible
Almost all rooms require full PPE gear
Home-work life balance is non-exsistent
Expect to get mandated every week
Can't keep people, had 3+ temp agency therapists on average per shift
You are watched constantly (at least 2 people watch you)
Get wrote up for small details (like how you put on/take off PPE)
Managers make rounds constantly to watch you

Run, go anywhere else but here. I currently work at another hospital and I am very happy there. My co-workers don't treat me like I'm in their way, they treat me like a peer.

pros: The hospital is well organized and creates a friendly employer employee relationship. With good benefits and salary it is a very good place to work.
cons: The hours in the maintenance department can be stressful such as the working conditions in inclement weather. Clearing the helo pad of snow is challenge.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Louisville, KY
pros: Positively impact patients lives everyday, strong job stability, stimulating work environment, well respected industrty, hours, flexibility
cons: Potentially inconsistent or overnight hours during certain weather conditions, unruly patients, exposure to illness (this is a big one for me since I have a small child), seeing patients struggle with illness, stressful situations may arise regularly.
